title: Pediatric Trauma BIG Score
desc: The Pediatric Trauma BIG Score stratifies severity of illness and predicts mortality in pediatric patients after trauma.

orgreference.text: Borgman MA, Maegele M, Wade CE, Blackbourne LH, Spinella PC. Pediatric Trauma BIG Score: Predicting Mortality in Children After Military and Civilian Trauma. Pediatrics. 2011 Apr;127(4):e892-7.

other_refer.text: Borgman MA, Spinella PC. What is the Big Deal about the BIG Score?. J Pediatr. 2015;167(3):513-4.

data.facts:
Predicted in-hospital mortality = 1/(1 + e-B), where B = 0.2 × (BIG Score) – 5.208

Note: Pediatric BIG Score of 26 (i.e., base deficit 10, INR 3.6, GCS 8) predicts a mortality of 50% with a positive predictive value of 65%, negative predictive value of 93%, and specificity of 99% (Borgman 2011).

Davis et al (2015) report the optimal BIG Score cutoff as 16. Mortality with cutoff <16 was 3/496 (0.6%, 95% CI 0.001-0.007) vs ≥16 which was 47/125 (ROC 38%, 95% CI 0.15-0.7) with p <0.0001.
